verses.verse: Wine<WH3196> is a mocker,<WH3887> strong drink<WH7941> is raging:<WH1993> and whoever<WH3605> is deceived<WH7686> thereby is not wise.<WH2449>
The fear<WH367> of a king<WH4428> is as the roaring<WH5099> of a lion:<WH3715> whoever provokes<WH5674> him to anger<WH5674> sins<WH2398> against his own soul.<WH5315>
It is an honor<WH3519> for a man<WH376> to cease<WH7674> from strife:<WH7379> but every<WH3605> fool<WH191> will be meddling.<WH1566>
The sluggard<WH6102> will not plow<WH2790> by reason of the cold;<WH2779> therefore shall he beg<WH7592> in harvest,<WH7105> and have nothing.<WH369>
Counsel<WH6098> in the heart<WH3820> of man<WH376> is like deep<WH6013> water;<WH4325> but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> will draw<WH1802> it out.
Most<WH7230> men<WH120> will proclaim<WH7121> every<WH376> one<WH376> his own goodness:<WH2617> but a faithful<WH529> man<WH376> who<WH4310> can find?<WH4672>
The just<WH6662> man walks<WH1980> in his integrity:<WH8537> his children<WH1121> are blessed<WH835> after<WH310> him.
A king<WH4428> that sits<WH3427> in the throne<WH3678> of judgment<WH1779> scatters<WH2219> away all<WH3605> evil<WH7451> with his eyes.<WH5869>
Who<WH4310> can say,<WH559> I have made my heart<WH3820> clean,<WH2135> I am pure<WH2891> from my sin?<WH2403>
Divers weights,<WH68> and divers measures,<WH374> both<WH8147> of them are alike<WH1571> abomination<WH8441> to the LORD.<WH3068>
Even<WH1571> a child<WH5288> is known<WH5234> by his doings,<WH4611> whether<WH518> his work<WH6467> be pure,<WH2134> and whether<WH518> it be right.<WH3477>
The hearing<WH8085> ear,<WH241> and the seeing<WH7200> eye,<WH5869> the LORD<WH3068> has made<WH6213> even<WH1571> both<WH8147> of them.
Love<WH157> not sleep,<WH8142> lest<WH6435> you come to poverty;<WH3423> open<WH6491> your eyes,<WH5869> and you shall be satisfied<WH7646> with bread.<WH3899>
It is naught,<WH7451> it is naught,<WH7451> said<WH559> the buyer:<WH7069> but when he is gone<WH235> his way, then<WH227> he boasts.<WH1984>
There is gold,<WH2091> and a multitude<WH7230> of rubies:<WH6443> but the lips<WH8193> of knowledge<WH1847> are a precious<WH3366> jewel.<WH3627>
Take<WH3947> his garment<WH899> that is surety<WH6148> for a stranger:<WH2114> and take<WH2254> a pledge<WH2254> of him for a strange<WH5237> woman.
Bread<WH3899> of deceit<WH8267> is sweet<WH6149> to a man;<WH376> but afterwards<WH310> his mouth<WH6310> shall be filled<WH4390> with gravel.<WH2687>
Every purpose<WH4284> is established<WH3559> by counsel:<WH6098> and with good advice<WH8458> make<WH6213> war.<WH4421>
He that goes<WH1980> about<WH1980> as a talebearer<WH7400> reveals<WH1540> secrets:<WH5475> therefore meddle<WH6148> not with him that flatters<WH6601> with his lips.<WH8193>
Whoever curses<WH7043> his father<WH1> or his mother,<WH517> his lamp<WH5216> shall be put<WH1846> out in obscure<WH380> darkness.<WH2822>
An inheritance<WH5159> may be gotten hastily<WH926> at the beginning;<WH7223> but the end<WH319> thereof shall not be blessed.<WH1288>
Say<WH559> not you, I will recompense<WH7999> evil;<WH7451> but wait<WH6960> on the LORD,<WH3068> and he shall save<WH3467> you.
Divers weights<WH68> are an abomination<WH8441> to the LORD;<WH3068> and a false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is not good.<WH2896>
Man's<WH1397> goings<WH4703> are of the LORD;<WH3068> how<WH4100> can a man<WH120> then understand<WH995> his own way?<WH1870>
It is a snare<WH4170> to the man<WH120> who devours<WH3216> that which is holy,<WH6944> and after<WH310> vows<WH5088> to make inquiry.<WH1239>
A wise<WH2450> king<WH4428> scatters<WH2219> the wicked,<WH7563> and brings<WH7725> the wheel<WH212> over<WH5921> them.
The spirit<WH5397> of man<WH120> is the candle<WH5216> of the LORD,<WH3068> searching<WH2664> all<WH3605> the inward<WH2315> parts of the belly.<WH990>
Mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> preserve<WH5341> the king:<WH4428> and his throne<WH3678> is upheld<WH5582> by mercy.<WH2617>
The glory<WH8597> of young<WH970> men is their strength:<WH3581> and the beauty<WH1926> of old<WH2205> men is the grey<WH7872> head.
The blueness<WH2250> of a wound<WH6482> cleans<WH8562> away evil:<WH7451> so do stripes<WH4347> the inward<WH2315> parts of the belly.<WH990>
